intro: Daboecia polifolia f. striata, commonly known as the striped rock rose, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, leathery leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Its flowers are typically pink or white, appearing in clusters during the spring. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or coastal environments.
